* is a good place to ensure all of our action labels
throw new Error(`Action type "${label}" is not unique"`);

* For each action type in an action group, make a simple
* enum object for all of this group's action types.

* payload. Expressing actions as classes enables powerful
* Export a type alias of all actions in this action group
* so that reducers can easily compose action types

â-ngmodule   (generate a regular lib instead of an ng module
Generate a lazy loaded Angular module lib with routing
Note: Use option --dry-run to first check what will be generated.
You can always add --help to learn more about the commands.
Generate a new root level store
Generate all the configuration in app.module.ts, without creating a store
Generate a new feature level store in an existing library
--dry-run Run through without making any changes.
--lint-fix Use lint to fix files after generation.
--module (string) Path to an Angular module (e.g., src/app/app.module.ts).
--only-add-files (boolean) Only add new NgRx files, without changing the module file (e.g., --onlyAddFiles).
--root (boolean) Add StoreModule.forRoot and EffectsModule.forRoot instead of forFeature (e.g., --root).
--only-empty-root (boolean) Do not generate any files. Only generate StoreModule.forRoot and EffectsModule.forRoot (e.g., --onlyEmptyRoot).
--skip-package-json (boolean) Do not add ngrx dependencies to package.json (e.g., --skipPackageJson)
Generate and serve an Angular project via a development server
You can use the ng generate (or just ng g)
All builds make use of bundling, and using the --prod flag in ng build --prod or ng serve --prod will also make use of uglifying and tree-shaking functionality.
Run tests with coverage. The report will be in the coverage/ directory
Tests will execute after a build is executed via Karma, and it will automatically watch your files for changes.
You can run tests a single time via --watch=false or --single-run.
Before running the tests make sure you are serving the app via ng serve. End-to-end tests are run via Protractor.
Lint you app code using tslint
Open the official Angular API documentation for a given keyword on angular.io.
